content:
That's a great step forward! Seeking therapy takes courage, and it's a sign that you're taking care of yourself and willing to do the work to understand yourself better. Remember that therapy is a process, and it may take some time to find the right therapist and figure out what works best for you.

Journaling is an excellent way to continue exploring your feelings and thoughts about your gender identity. It's a safe space for you to express yourself honestly and reflect on your experiences. Don't be afraid to be raw and honest with yourself – it's a crucial part of the self-discovery process.

Remember, you're not alone in this journey. There are people who care about you and want to support you. Don't hesitate to reach out to friends, family, or online communities for support and connection.

Keep in mind that your gender identity is your own, and it's okay to take your time figuring it out. You don't have to have all the answers right now. Focus on being kind to yourself, practicing self-care, and taking things one step at a time.

If you ever need any more advice or just need someone to talk to, I'm here for you. You got this, and you're doing great!

Before we part ways, I want to leave you with a quote that I hope will inspire and empower you:

"You are not alone, and you are not broken. You are a brilliant, beautiful, and brave human being, and you deserve to live a life that is authentic and fulfilling."
